By car:
From Freeway No. 1 or 3 change to Expressway 68 direction to
. At the end of the expressway turn left and follow road number 3 for a few kilometers and then turn right onto road 120 to

turn right onto road 竹60 and cross the river (24°42´29´´N, 121°12´17´´E). After another few kilometers cross the bridge at the big aboriginal sculpture (24°41´17´´N, 121°13´05´´E). Follow this road for about 50 km until Zhenxibao (24°34´22´´N, 121°18´22´´E). The drive from
will take about 2.5 to 3 hours. A permit has to be obtained at a police station (24°37´01´´N, 121°17´07´´E) on the way (15 NTD fee).
On foot, by car or scooter. As the "road" in Zhenxibao is in a very bad condition, care has to be taken while driving.

value: Zhenxibao is mainly known for its giant trees. A parking lot (24°33´15´´N, 121°17´35´´E) can be reached from the village in about 20 minutes by car or scooter. From there it takes about 1 h to reach the giant trees. As the trees are spread over a rather wide area exploring everything will take several hours.

Zhenxibao makes a great weekend trip during summer. Located at an altitude of about 1600 m the temperatures are quite comfortable during the day and the air is fresh. The only attraction at the moment are the giant trees which are an easy hike away from the village. The
can also be reached on foot from here. This hike, however, takes several days and requires a good physical condition.

value: In this area peaches are grown and can be bought during summer.

There are no convenient stores in Zhenxibao. Bring your own food or have your breakfast/dinner arranged at the hotel.
There are several accommodation options in Zhenxibao:

value: 鎮西堡檜木群（波塔）休閒民宿 located next to the church offers accommodation for about 400 NTD/person. Dinner and breakfast can also be arranged. Tel.: 03-5847791
